rows.title: Character
rows.titleText: Your character starts at the level specified in the Meta section. You can freely choose any Heritage and Background you qualify from with your Heritage.

objects.title: Level 0
objects.text: You start at level 0. You can select an ancestry, heritage, background, archetype, skills and purchase items with gold but you cannot choose a class or feats.

objects.title: Level 1
objects.text: You start at level 1, a beginner adventurer.

objects.title: Level 6
objects.text: You start at level 6, an experienced adventurer.

objects.title: Level 12
objects.text: You start at level 12, a seasoned adventurer.

objects.title: Level 20
objects.text: You start at level the maximum level of 20, you are among the most experienced adventurers alive. Legends of your exploits are sung about by bards everywhere.

objects.title: Multiclass
objects.text: You can pick more than one class and choose at which levels they advance. For example, if you are level 8, you might have 5 levels in fighter and 3 levels in Kineticist.

objects.title: Gestalt
objects.text: You can pick more than one class which all progress at the same time. You could be a Fighter/Monk or Wizard/Psychic, or even a Magus/Rogue/Alchemist if you wish.

objects.title: Skilled
objects.text: You gain extra skill points.

objects.title: Wealthy
objects.text: Need more gold to buy equipment?

objects.title: Favored by the Gods
objects.text: You gain additional fate points.

objects.title: Dwarf
objects.text: Dwarves are a short, stocky people who are often stubborn, fierce, and devoted. Size: Medium Ability Boosts: Constitution, Wisdom, Free Ability Flaws: Charisma Languages: Common, Dwarven

objects.title: Elf
objects.text: Elves are a tall, long-lived people with a strong tradition of art and magic. Size: Medium Ability Boosts: Dexterity, Intelligence, Free Ability Flaws: Constitution Languages: Common, Elven

objects.title: Gnome
objects.text: Gnomes are short and hardy folk, with an unquenchable curiosity and eccentric habits. Size: Small Ability Boosts: Constitution, Charisma, Free Ability Flaws: Strength Languages: Common, Fey, Gnomish

objects.title: Goblin
objects.text: Goblins are a short, scrappy, energetic people who have spent millennia maligned and feared. Size: Small Ability Boosts: Dexterity, Charisma, Free Ability Flaws: Wisdom Languages: Common, Goblin

objects.title: Halfling
objects.text: Halflings are a short, resilient people who exhibit remarkable curiosity and humor. Size: Small Ability Boosts: Dexterity, Wisdom, Free Ability Flaws: Strength Languages: Common, Halfling

objects.title: Human
objects.text: Humans are diverse and adaptable people with wide potential and deep ambitions. Size: Medium Ability Boosts: Any two abilities Ability Flaws: None Languages: Common, One language of your choice

objects.title: Leshy
objects.text: Leshies are immortal nature spirits placed in small plant bodies, seeking to experience the world. Size: Small Ability Boosts: Constitution, Wisdom, Free Ability Flaws: Intelligence Languages: Common, Fey

objects.title: Orc
objects.text: Orcs are proud, strong people with hardened physiques who value physical might and glory in combat. Size: Medium Ability Boosts: Any two abilities Ability Flaws: None Languages: Common, Orcish

objects.title: Azarketi
objects.text: Azarketis, inheritors of a shattered empire's legacy, hold their proud traditions close but still surface to interact with the rest of the world.

objects.title: Catfolk
objects.text: Curious and gregarious wanderers, catfolk combine features of felines and humanoids in both appearance and temperament. They enjoy learning new things, collecting new tales and trinkets, and ensuring their loved ones are safe and happy. Catfolk view themselves as chosen guardians of natural places in the world and are often recklessly brave, even in the face of overwhelming opposition.

rows.title: Abilities
rows.titleText:
Every character has six basic abilities, they are his raw talent and prowess:
  • Strength which measures muscle and physical power;
  • Dexterity which measures agility, reflexes, and balance;
  • Constitution which represents your character’s health and stamina;
  • Intelligence which determines how well your character learns and reasons;
  • Wisdom which describes your character’s willpower, common sense, awareness, and intuition;
  • Charisma which measures a character’s personality, personal magnetism, ability to lead, and appearance.
Each ability score generally ranges from 3 to 18, although bonuses and penalties from your Ancestry, Heritage, and Background can alter this; an average ability score is 10. An Ability Boost increases a score by 2 until it reaches 18, then it only raises it by 1. An Ability Flaw reduces a score by 2. Which abilities you emphasize determine what kind of adventurer you will be. Fighters prioritize strength, Rogues focus on dexterity, Wizards have high intelligence, and Clerics have plenty of wisdom.

objects.title: Basic Abilities
objects.text: You have the basic abilities of an adventurer. Assign the following scores to your abilities as you see fit: 18, 16, 14, 12, 12, 10.

objects.title: Heroic Abilities
objects.text: You stand above regular adventurers. Assign the following scores to your abilities as you see fit: 18, 16, 16, 14, 14, 12.

objects.title: Legendary
objects.text: You stand above even heroic adventurers and have stepped into the realm of legends. Assign the following scores to your abilities as you see fit: 18, 18, 16, 16, 14, 12.

objects.title: Basic Progression
objects.text: You gain 4 ability boosts at levels 5, 10, 15, and 20.

objects.title: Heroic Progression
objects.text: You gain 4 ability boosts at levels 5, 10, 15, and 20 as well as 2 ability boosts at levels 3, 8, 13, and 18.

objects.title: Legendary Progression
objects.text: You gain 4 ability boosts at levels 3, 5, 8, 10, 13, 15, 18, and 20.

objects.title: Alchemist
objects.text: There’s no sight more beautiful to you than a strange brew bubbling in a beaker, and you consume your ingenious elixirs with abandon. You’re fascinated by uncovering the secrets of science and the natural world, and you’re constantly experimenting in your lab or on the go with inventive concoctions for every eventuality. You are fearless in the face of risk, hurling explosive or toxic creations at your foes. Your unique path toward greatness is lined with alchemical brews that push your mind and body to their limits. Key Attribute: Intelligence Skills: Crafting, and 3 skills of your choice Training: Simple Weapons, Light & Medium Armor. You understand the complex interactions of natural and unnatural substances and can concoct alchemical items to meet your needs. You can do this using normal reagents, or you can use special infused reagents that allow you to craft temporary items quickly and at no cost. Over time, you can create more and more alchemical items for free, and since each of them becomes more and more powerful, you advance in power dramatically, leaving behind those who don't understand your strange science. During your daily preparations, you infuse reagents with your own alchemical essence, allowing you to create alchemical items at no cost. The higher your level, the more reagents you will be able to infuse every day. These reagents expire when you make your next preparations but can be used at any time in between. An alchemist keeps meticulous records of the formulas for every item they can create. You start out with a simple book and add formula as you gain levels and progress through your research.

objects.title: Barbarian
objects.text: Rage consumes you in battle. You delight in wreaking havoc and using powerful weapons to carve through your enemies, relying on astonishing durability without needing complicated techniques or rigid training. Your rages draw upon a vicious instinct, which you might associate with an animal, a spirit, or some part of yourself. To many barbarians, brute force is a hammer and every problem looks like a nail, whereas others try to hold back the storm of emotions inside them and release their rage only when it matters most.

objects.title: Bard
objects.text: You are a master of artistry, a scholar of hidden secrets, and a captivating persuader. Using powerful performances, you influence minds and elevate souls to new levels of heroics. You might use your powers to become a charismatic leader, or perhaps you might instead be a counselor, manipulator, scholar, scoundrel, or virtuoso. While your versatility leads some to consider you a beguiling ne’erdo- well and a jack-of-all-trades, it’s dangerous to dismiss you as a master of none.

objects.title: Champion
objects.text: You are an emissary of a deity, a devoted servant who has taken up a weighty mantle, and you adhere to a code that holds you apart from those around you. While champions exist for every alignment, as a champion of good, you provide certainty and hope to the innocent. You have powerful defenses that you share freely with your allies and innocent bystanders, as well as holy power you use to end the threat of evil. Your devotion even attracts the attention of holy spirits who aid you on your journey.

objects.title: Cleric
objects.text: Deities work their will upon the world in infinite ways, and you serve as one of their most stalwart mortal servants. Blessed with divine magic, you live the ideals of your faith, adorn yourself with the symbols of your church, and train diligently to wield your deity’s favored weapon. Your spells might protect and heal your allies, or they might punish foes and enemies of your faith, as your deity wills. Yours is a life of devotion, spreading the teachings of your faith through both word and deed.

objects.title: Druid
objects.text: The power of nature is impossible to resist. It can bring ruin to the stoutest fortress in minutes, reducing even the mightiest works to rubble, burning them to ash, burying them beneath an avalanche of snow, or drowning them beneath the waves. It can provide endless bounty and breathtaking splendor to those who respect it— and an agonizing death to those who take it too lightly. You are one of those who hear nature’s call. You stand in awe of the majesty of its power and give yourself over to its service.

objects.title: Fighter
objects.text: Fighting for honor, greed, loyalty, or simply the thrill of battle, you are an undisputed master of weaponry and combat techniques. You combine your actions through clever combinations of opening moves, finishing strikes, and counterattacks whenever your foes are unwise enough to drop their guard. Whether you are a knight, mercenary, sharpshooter, or blade master, you have honed your martial skills into an art form and perform devastating critical attacks on your enemies.

objects.title: Investigator
objects.text: You seek to uncover the truth, doggedly pursuing leads to reveal the plots of devious villains, discover ancient secrets, or unravel other mysteries. Your analytical mind quickly formulates solutions to complicated problems and your honed senses identify even the most obscure clues. Wielding knowledge as a weapon, you study the creatures and dangers you encounter to exploit their weaknesses.

objects.title: Kineticist
objects.text: The power of the elements flows from within you. Roaring fire, pure water, fleeting air, steadfast earth, twisting wood, slicing metal. A kinetic gate inextricably tied to your body channels power directly from the elemental planes, causing elements to leap to your hand, whirl around your body, and blast foes at your whim. As your connection to the planes grows, you attain true mastery over your chosen elements.

objects.title: Magus
objects.text: Combining the physicality and technique of a warrior with the ability to cast arcane magic, you seek to perfect the art of fusing spell and strike. While the hefty tome you carry reflects hours conducting arcane research, your enemies need no reminder of your training. They recognize it as you take them down.

objects.title: Monk
objects.text: The strength of your fist flows from your mind and spirit. You seek perfection—honing your body into a flawless instrument and your mind into an orderly bastion of wisdom. You’re a fierce combatant renowned for martial arts skills and combat stances that grant you unique fighting moves. While the challenge of mastering many fighting styles drives you to great heights, you also enjoy meditating on philosophical questions and discovering new ways to obtain peace and enlightenment.

objects.title: Oracle
objects.text: Your conduit to divine power eschews the traditional channels of prayer and servitude—you instead glean divine truths that extend beyond any single deity. You understand the great mysteries of the universe embodied in overarching concepts that transcend good and evil or chaos and law, whether because you perceive the common ground across multiple deities or circumvent their power entirely. You explore one of these mysteries and draw upon its power to cast miraculous spells, but that power comes with a terrible price: a curse that grows stronger the more you draw upon it. Your abilities are a double-edged sword, which you might uphold as an instrument of the divine or view as a curse from the gods.

objects.title: Psychic
objects.text: The mind can perceive truths hidden to fine-tuned instruments, house more secrets than any tome, and move objects and hearts more deftly than any lever. By delving into both the conscious and subconscious aspects of your inner self, you have awoken to the might of psychic magic, allowing you to cast spells not through incantations or gestures but by the power of your will alone. While the thin line between your mind and reality means that a single errant thought could have unintended consequences for yourself and your companions, you know that anything is possible, if you can imagine it.

objects.title: Ranger
objects.text: Some rangers believe civilization wears down the soul, but still needs to be protected from wild creatures. Others say nature needs to be protected from the greedy, who wish to tame its beauty and plunder its treasures. You could champion either goal, or both. You might be a scout, tracker, or hunter of fugitives or beasts, haunting the edge of civilization or exploring the wilds. You know how to live off the land and are skilled at spotting and taking down both opportune prey and hated enemies.

objects.title: Rogue
objects.text: You are skilled and opportunistic. Using your sharp wits and quick reactions, you take advantage of your opponents’ missteps and strike where it hurts most. You play a dangerous game, seeking thrills and testing your skills, and likely don’t care much for any laws that happen to get in your way. While the path of every rogue is unique and riddled with danger, the one thing you all share in common is the breadth and depth of your skills.

objects.title: Sorcerer
objects.text: You didn’t choose to become a spellcaster—you were born one. There’s magic in your blood, whether a divinity touched one of your ancestors, a forebear communed with a primal creature, or a powerful occult ritual influenced your line. Self-reflection and study allow you to refine your inherent magical skills and unlock new, more powerful abilities. The power in your blood carries a risk, however, and you constantly face the choice of whether you’ll rise to become a master spellcaster or fall into destruction.

objects.title: Summoner
objects.text: You can magically beckon a powerful being called an eidolon to your side, serving as the mortal conduit that anchors it to the world. Whether your eidolon is a friend, a servant, or even a personal god, your connection to it marks you as extraordinary, shaping the course of your life dramatically

objects.title: Swashbuckler
objects.text: You can magically beckon a powerful being called an eidolon to your side, serving as the mortal conduit that anchors it to the world. Whether your eidolon is a friend, a servant, or even a personal god, your connection to it marks you as extraordinary, shaping the course of your life dramatically

objects.title: Thaumaturge
objects.text: The world is full of the unexplainable: ancient magic, dead gods, and even stranger things. In response, you've scavenged the best parts of every magical tradition and built up a collection of esoterica—a broken holy relic here, a sprig of mistletoe there—that you can use to best any creature by exploiting their weaknesses and vulnerabilities. The mystic implement you carry is both badge and weapon, its symbolic weight helping you bargain with and subdue the supernatural. Every path to power has its restrictions and costs, but you turn them all to your advantage. You're a thaumaturge, and you work wonders.

objects.title: Witch
objects.text: You command powerful magic, not through study or devotion to any ideal, but as a vessel or agent for a mysterious, otherworldly patron that even you don't entirely understand. This entity might be a covert divinity, a powerful fey, a manifestation of natural energies, an ancient spirit, or any other mighty supernatural being—but its nature is likely as much a mystery to you as it is to anyone else. Through a special familiar, your patron grants you versatile spells and powerful hexes to use as you see fit, though you're never certain if these gifts will end up serving your patron's larger plan.

objects.title: Wizard
objects.text: You are an eternal student of the arcane secrets of the universe, using your mastery of magic to cast powerful and devastating spells. You treat magic like a science, cross-referencing the latest texts on practical spellcraft with ancient esoteric tomes to discover and understand how magic works. Yet magical theory is vast, and there’s no way you can study it all. You either specialize in one of the eight schools of magic, gaining deeper understanding of the nuances of those spells above all others, or favor a broader approach that emphasizes the way all magic comes together at the expense of depth.

objects.title: Dedication Archetypes
objects.text: These archetypes allow you to dabble in certain classes without the need to multiclass into them.

objects.title: Alchemist Dedication
objects.text: You enjoy tinkering with alchemical formulas and substances in your spare time, and your studies have progressed beyond mere experimentation.

objects.title: Barbarian Dedication
objects.text: There’s a rage deep inside you that sometimes breaks loose, granting you some of the might of a barbarian in addition to your other abilities.

objects.title: Bard Dedication
objects.text: A muse has called you to dabble in occult lore, allowing you to cast a few spells. The deeper you delve, the more powerful your performances become.

objects.title: Champion Dedication
objects.text: You have sworn a solemn oath to your deity, who has granted you champion powers to aid you in your cause.

objects.title: Cleric Dedication
objects.text: You are an ordained priest of your deity and have even learned how to cast a few divine spells. Though your main training lies elsewhere, your religious calling provides you divine gifts.

objects.title: Druid Dedication
objects.text: You have entered a druidic circle and learned a few of the order’s secrets, granting you primal power.

objects.title: Fighter Dedication
objects.text: You have spent time learning the art of warfare, increasing your skill with martial arms and at wearing armor. With further training, you can become a true combat specialist.

objects.title: Kineticist Dedication
objects.text: You have, intentionally or accidentally, awoken a gateway to elemental power inside yourself and can now channel that power to devastating effect, adding an elemental arsenal to your abilities.

objects.title: Magus Dedication
objects.text: You've mixed physical combat with spellcasting.

objects.title: Monk Dedication
objects.text: Monastic training has taught you martial arts and allowed you to hone your mind, body, and spirit to new heights.

objects.title: Oracle Dedication
objects.text: A mysterious force granted you divine magic and a curse.

objects.title: Psychic Dedication
objects.text: You've awoken the latent abilities of your mind, taking your first steps into wielding psychic magic.

objects.title: Ranger Dedication
objects.text: You have studied hunting, tracking, and wilderness survival, adding a ranger’s tools to your skill set. Your keen eyes while hunting prey help gather more information.

objects.title: Rogue Dedication
objects.text: You’ve learned to sneak, steal, and disable traps. With time and luck, you’ll become capable of moving through the shadows, striking unseen, and escaping without notice.

objects.title: Sorcerer Dedication
objects.text: You coax the magic power in your blood to manifest, accessing magic others don’t expect you to have.

objects.title: Summoner Dedication
objects.text: You have a tenuous connection to an eidolon, a bodiless being that shares your life force, and with effort you can manifest the eidolon into the world.

objects.title: Thaumatuge Dedication
objects.text: Scraps of knowledge have taught you how to exploit the vulnerabilities of creatures and the powers of mystical objects.

objects.title: Witch Dedication
objects.text: You have heard the whispers of a distant patron, who sent an emissary to teach you powerful magic.

objects.title: Wizard Dedication
objects.text: You have dabbled in the arcane arts and, through discipline and academic study, learned how to cast a few spells.

objects.title: Hybrid Archetypes
objects.text: These powerful archetypes merge the features of multiple classes into one, granting powerful benefits.

objects.title: Arcanist
objects.text:
Some spellcasters seek the secrets of magic, pursuing the power to make the impossible possible. Others are born with magic in their blood, commanding unbelievable forces as effortlessly as they breathe. Yet still others seek to meld the science of arcane scholars with the natural might of innate casters. These arcanists seek to discover the mysterious laws of magic and through will and expertise bend those forces to their whims. Arcanists are the shapers and tinkers of the arcane world, and no magic can resist their control.
<hr/>You no longer prepare spells directly into individual slots. Instead, you gain a collection which allows you to prepare any spell from your spellbook during your daily preparations. When you cast a spell from your collection, you use a spell slot of the appropriate level. You can heighten the spell or apply metamagic both during preparations and when you cast the spell.

You gain access to Arcanist Exploits which can be fuelled by using your focus pool. You gain one exploit at first level and every odd level afterwards. Your focus pool increases by two points.

objects.title: Shaman
objects.text:
While some heroes speak to gods or consort with otherworldly muses, shamans commune with the spirits of the world and the energies that exist in every living thing. These divine adventurers draw upon their power to shape the world and expand the influence of their spiritual patrons. Shamans have strong ties to natural spirits. They form powerful bonds with particular spirits, and as their power grows they learn to call upon other spirits in times of need.
<hr/>A shaman forms a mystical bond with the spirits of the world. Your form a lasting bond with a single spirit which grants you your power. The spells and hexes you have access to depends on the nature of the spirit. Your connection strengthens at 8th and 16th level, granting you access to more of your spirit's abilities.

In addition, you form a bond with a spirit animal which acts as your conduit to the spirit world and acts as your familiar. Your spirit animal can act as a conduit for your spells and you can commune with it to empower yourself.
You gain the ability to cast hexes fuelled by your focus pool. You gain your first hex at level 2 and every even level arfterwards. Your focus pool increases by two points.

objects.title: Hunter
objects.text:
Hunters are warriors of the wilds that have forged close bonds with trusted animal companions. They focus their tactics on fighting alongside their companion animals as a formidable team of two. Able to cast a wide variety of nature spells and take on the abilities and attributes of beasts, hunters magically improve both themselves and their animal companions.
<hr/>

objects.title: Slayer
objects.text:
Skilled at tracking down targets, slayers are consummate hunters, living for the chase and the deadly stroke that brings it to a close. Slayers spend most of their time honing their weapon skills, studying the habits and anatomy of foes, and practicing combat maneuvers.
<hr/>

objects.title: Archer
objects.text: Bows of all types are powerful weapons. Generals and hunters alike recognize the power in dealing death from long distances, and from behind cover. Those dedicated to the bow—from mysterious cloaked strangers to heartless snipers—are often viewed with a mixture of respect and fear. Like any weapon adept, the archer's skill is forged through experience and constant practice. A true archer becomes one with the bow and is able to accomplish with that weapon things that most would consider impossible, or at least nearly magical.

objects.title: Asassin
objects.text: Targeted killing through stealth and subterfuge is the expertise of an assassin. While assassins are skilled in ending lives and many are evil, some live by a moral code, preying on the wicked, the cruel, or those who revel in unchecked aggression or power.

objects.title: Cavalier
objects.text: You are a skilled and dedicated warrior of the battlefield who specializes in fighting astride a powerful animal companion that serves as your mount. You and your mount are an unparalleled team, moving with shared intent to become a powerful force on the battlefield. You might wield a banner in the name of a greater organization, a liege, or an ideal you uphold, or you might fight solely to further enrich your own prestige, reputation, and coffers.

objects.title: Duelist
objects.text: Across the world, students in martial academies practice with their blades to master one-on-one combat. The libraries of such schools hold deep troves of information detailing hundreds of combat techniques, battle stances, and honorable rules of engagement. Those who gain admission to such schools might train in formalized duels—and that's certainly the more genteel route to take. However, others assert that there's no better place to try out dueling techniques than in the life-and-death struggles common to an adventurer's life.

objects.title: Eldritch Archer
objects.text:
While many archers see their craft as an art form as much as a means of battle, a small number of archers seek to perfect their skills through magic, and you are among their number. Bolstering your athletic and martial abilities with mystical talents, you achieve rare heights with the bow or crossbow—transforming arrows or bolts into eldritch ammunition, sending arrows zig-zagging nearly unerringly to their target, and manifesting arrows that can deliver spells or even instant death.

While having some spellcasting ability increases your potential flexibility and power as an eldritch archer, you might learn the secrets of these arts without being independently skilled in spellcasting, instead learning the magic of the bow for its own sake.

objects.title: Exorcist
objects.text: You pacify restless spirits, ghosts, and haunts, capturing fragments of them and using their vengeful energies to fuel your own powers while purifying the spirit. You store these ghosts within a magical vessel called a spirit dwelling. This spirit dwelling might be a treasured family heirloom, an item you crafted expressly to help with exorcisms, or even just an odd trinket you found that happens to do the job.

objects.title: Gladiator
objects.text: The roar of the crowd and thrill of competitive combat drive you to become the best—and the fame isn't bad either.

objects.title: Herbalist
objects.text: The plants around you can provide more remedies than the finest hospital or temple, and you are skilled in their use.

objects.title: Marshal
objects.text: Marshals are leaders, first and foremost. Marshals can come from any class or background, though they all share a willingness to sacrifice their own glory for the greater good of the team. Some marshals lead from the front, sword and shield raised, while others may call instructions and encouragements from the rear while providing allied spellcasters with skilled support. Regardless of their preferred method of combat, marshals' ability to bring the best out in every ally is a valuable addition to any group.

objects.title: Medic
objects.text: You've studied countless techniques for providing medical aid, making you a peerless doctor and healer.

objects.title: Pirate
objects.text:
You live a life of freedom, taking by force and intimidation all that you desire. You may be a privateer, raiding and plundering on behalf of a particular nation or another authority, or you may answer to no one but your own capricious whims. Either way, you rely on intimidation, wits, and combat prowess to take what you want from those you deem less deserving.

Pirates have much in common with swashbucklers, and many pirates have the swashbuckler class or archetype. Much like a swashbuckler's daring deeds, classic pirate maneuvers are often showy feats intended to impress, intimidate, and gain panache. For example, if you have the panache class feature and your Acrobatics check for a Boarding Assault exceeds the very hard DC for your level, you would gain panache.

objects.title: Poisoner
objects.text: People are so delightfully fragile when exposed to the glories of nature. The bite of a certain serpent makes the blood congeal to jelly. A particular stone, suitably powdered, causes hallucinations and delirium. The sap of a tree inflicts such pain that death seems preferable. You are a student of such dark wonders, making you a dangerous foe indeed.

objects.title: Ritualist
objects.text: While some learn the art of ritual casting through rigorous study, other gifted individuals may find that a combination of natural talent and luck gives them surprising skill at performing rituals, whether they want that power or not.

objects.title: Scout
objects.text: You're an expert in espionage and reconnaissance, able to skulk silently through the wilderness to gather intelligence, sneak through enemy lines to report to your comrades, or suddenly and decisively strike your foes. Your skills ease the difficulty of travel for you and your companions and keep you all on guard when you're approaching danger.

objects.title: Sentinel
objects.text: Armor offers solid, reassuring protection in combat, and as someone who faces danger on a regular basis, you have made it your business to get the most out of your defenses. You stand solid on any battlefield, encased in the sturdiest armor you can find. When danger threatens, your solid defenses will safely get you, and possibly your companions, home again. As a sentinel, you might be a member of an order of knights or bodyguards that trained you how best to take advantage of heavy armor. On the other hand, you might just be an adventurer who took one too many scrapes and decided that enough was enough, so you trained yourself to wear the heaviest plate you could get your hands on. Some witches or sorcerers have chosen to follow the path of the sentinel to increase their survivability.

objects.title: Swordmaster
objects.text: Though the ultimate goal of the Pathfinder society is to learn, knowledge cannot be spread if those who discover it fail to come back alive. The Master of Swords teaches recruits to survive, to defend other Pathfinders, and to defeat the Society’s enemies. The swordmaster embodies these skills, focusing on practicality and ignoring ideals or methods that interfere with their ability to overcome any challenge.

objects.title: Acrobatics
objects.text: Acrobatics measures your ability to perform tasks requiring coordination and grace.

objects.title: Arcana
objects.text: Arcana measures how much you know about arcane magic and creatures.

objects.title: Athletics
objects.text: Athletics allows you to perform deeds of physical prowess.

objects.title: Crafting
objects.text: You can use this skill to create and repair items.

objects.title: Deception
objects.text: You can trick and mislead others using disguises, lies, and other forms of subterfuge. Deception often has a drawback if you get found out, and it's often best to be out of town by the time this happens.

objects.title: Diplomacy
objects.text: You influence others through negotiation and flattery, or find out information through friendly chats.

objects.title: Intimidation
objects.text: You bend others to your will using threats. Unlike Deception or Diplomacy, Intimidation is typically a blunt instrument with little room for nuance or care.

objects.title: Medicine
objects.text: You can patch up wounds and help people recover from diseases and poisons.

objects.title: Nature
objects.text: You know about the natural world, and you command and train animals and magical beasts.

objects.title: Occultism
objects.text: You know a great deal about ancient philosophies, esoteric lore, obscure mysticism, and supernatural creatures.

objects.title: Performance
objects.text: You are skilled at a form of performance, using your talents to impress a crowd or make a living.

objects.title: Religion
objects.text: The secrets of deities, dogma, faith, and the realms of divine creatures both sublime and sinister are open to you. You also understand how magic works, though your training imparts a religious slant to that knowledge.

objects.title: Society
objects.text: You understand the people and systems that make civilization run, and you know the historical events that make societies what they are today. Further, you can use that knowledge to navigate the complex physical, societal, and economic workings of settlements.

objects.title: Stealth
objects.text: You are skilled at avoiding detection, allowing you to slip past foes, hide, or conceal an item.

objects.title: Survival
objects.text: You are adept at living in the wilderness, foraging for food and building shelter, and with training you discover the secrets of tracking and hiding your trail.

objects.title: Thievery
objects.text: You are trained in a particular set of skills favored by thieves and miscreants.

objects.title: Wizard Tools
objects.text:
You can create an arcane bond with multiple items at once. You start with two and can bond with one more every 6 levels.

Each of your bonded items can be drained an additional time to recover a spell slot or focus point. The number of charges in your items increases every 6 levels. Those charges refresh during your daily preparations.

Additionally, your bonded items can be used to store spells like a wand or staff. Each item can only hold a limited number of slots, one third your level, and they can only store spells above first level that are two levels below your maximum.

If your bonded items are lost or stolen, you can recall them back to you by expending a focus point.

objects.title: Counterspell
objects.text:
You can use your magic to disrupt other spells. When another person casts a spell and you have it in your spellbook, you can spend a spell slot of the same level to counteract its effects.

If the spell is targeted at you, you can either redirect the spell towards another target of your choice or absorb the spell into a temporary slot. You can only have one absorbed spell every four levels, they do not disappear during your daily preparations.

At level 20, you gain the ability to counter spells from other traditions.

objects.title: Archwizard's Might
objects.text:
You gain the ability to split and merge spells slots int slots two levels higher or lower during your daily preparations. You can only modify a number of slots equivalent to half your level rounded up.

You gain the ability to prepare two different spells in a single slot during your preparations. When you cast one spell from that slot, the other is forgotten. You can also create slots with infinite potential which allow you to cast any spell from your spellbook two levels lower than the slot. Both of those abilities are limited to 1 slot per 4 levels.

You also gain the ability to combine two spells into a single slot to merge their effects together. This ability is limited to one slot per 6 levels.

At level 20, you gain access to two 10th level spell slots. Those slots cannot be split or merged but can be used with the rest of your archwizard abilities.

objects.title: Magical Crafting
objects.text:
You can create magic items, potions, tattoos, and scrolls. You are also able to improve items and attach runes to them.

You start with a collection of low-level schematics and formulas. If you start above level one or your crafting level is higher, you expand your collection accordingly.

objects.title: Battle Medic
objects.text:
You gain the ability to heal wounds and treat diseases without spells. You have the knowledge to create medicines and tools used for healing from mundane materials.

In combat, you can efficiently treat your allies and get them back on their feet in no time. As long as their heart beats, you can save them.

objects.title: Crystal Healing
objects.text: You know magical techniques to heal. You can use a variety of esoteric implements such as crystals or talismans to heal wounds or treat diseases.

objects.title: Adventuring Gear
objects.text:
The basics needed to go out in the wilderness and explore dungeons. Quality camping supplies, cooking equipment, and so on ...

Includes a free non-magical backpack to store everything.

objects.title: Starting Class Kit
objects.text: Basic equipment for your class(es). You get a simple weapon and a shield. Some clothes which can protect you from the cold but are not armor. For classes that need other equipment, like Wizard or Thaumaturge, you also get what you need from this.

objects.title: Light Armor
objects.text: You get a full set of light armor. It can be leather armor, a chain shirt, quilted armor, etc. but is not made of any special materials.

objects.title: Medium Armor
objects.text: You get a full set of medium armor. It can be scale or chain mail, a breastplate, hide armor, etc. but is not made of any special materials.

objects.title: Heavy Armor
objects.text: You get a full set of heavy armor. It can be full plate, half plate, etc. but is not made of any special materials.

objects.title: Martial Weapon
objects.text: You get a martial weapon of your choice. These weapons require special training to use effectively.

objects.title: Advanced Weapon
objects.text: You get an advanced weapon of your choice. These weapons are uncommon and require special training to use effectively.

objects.title: Magic Wand (1st Rank)
objects.text: This simple magic wand can be loaded with a 1st level spell of your choice which can be cast once per day.

objects.title: Magic Wand (3rd Rank)
objects.text: This simple magic wand can be loaded with a 3rd level spell of your choice which can be cast once per day.

objects.title: Magic Wand (6th Rank)
objects.text: This simple magic wand can be loaded with a 6th level spell of your choice which can be cast once per day.

objects.title: Magic Wand (9th Rank)
objects.text: This simple magic wand can be loaded with a 9th level spell of your choice which can be cast once per day.

objects.title: Spacious Pouch (Type I)
objects.text: Though it appears to be a cloth bag decorated with panels of richly colored silk or stylish embroidery, a spacious pouch opens into a magical space larger than its outside dimensions.

objects.title: Staff of Elemental Power
objects.text: This staff is tapered at the base and carved into a gem-studded twist at the top. While wielding the staff, you gain a circumstance bonus to identify elemental creatures. Spells: frostbite, breathe fire, pummeling rubble, thunderstrike, blazing bolt, resist energy

rows.title: Location
rows.titleText: Where do you start your adventure?

objects.title: Absalom
objects.text:
The city at the center of the world, and the hub of the Pathfinder Society. Also the home
of the Starstone proving grounds.The city is an incredible trade hub, and interestingly
nobody pays property taxes. Absalom is presided over by the Grand Council, headed by
Lord Gyr of House Gixx. Though largely populated by humans, most races and creeds
are tolerated (though acceptance varies) here due to widespread integration and trade.
Beyond the city itself, the rest of the Isle of Kotors is mostly wilderness, with a few small
towns on the waterfront. Additionally, there’s also the mirror Shadow Absalom, located
on the Plane of Shadows, to which there is a permanent portal. There, Fetchlings and
undead will find themselves at home.

objects.title: Somewhere Else
objects.text: You appear in a settlement or location if your choice.

objects.title: Middle of Nowhere
objects.text: You appear in the middle of nowhere. Maybe a large forest, maybe endless plains, or maybe somewhere else. In any case, you are far from civilization but it shouldn't be very hard to make your way back. Survival training is recommended

objects.title: Hostile Envionment
objects.text: You appear in the middle of somewhere hostile. Maybe an endless desert, or a freezing tundra, or a poisonous swamp. In any case, you are far from civilization and making your way back will be difficult. Survival training is recommended

objects.title: Another Plane
objects.text: You are away from the material plane. Perhaps you appear in the Astral Plane, the Shadow Plane or maybe even the Abyss.

rows.title: Adventures
rows.titleText: Adventures are around every corner of the world. You can choose up to three among the ones on offer here or create your own, the world is your oyster.

objects.title: Warden of Wildwood
objects.text:
After generations of violence, Taldor and the Wildwood Lodge negotiate lasting peace with the Treaty of the Wildwood. As forest-dwellers gather for the annual Greenwood Gala, the election of Lodge leadership, and the renewal of the treaty, there’s an opportunity to resolve old grudges—and as much potential to spark war.
<hr/>

objects.title: Season of Ghosts
objects.text:
Something strange is happening to your hometown of Willowshore! Over the four seasons to come, you and your fellow home-grown heroes must face evil spirits, sinister fiends, and frightening curses, lest the town of Willowshore succumb to the Season of Ghosts!
<hr/>

objects.title: Sky King's Tomb
objects.text:
Millennia ago, the dwarven creator god Torag shook the earth and called the dwarves to the surface in the Quest for Sky. Taargick rose from the hardships of this journey, becoming the Sky King of Highhelm.…And then he vanished without a trace.
<hr/>

objects.title: Stolen Fate
objects.text:
Not even destiny itself is safe when powerful forces seek to seize control of the future, and now it falls to a band of heroes selected by the power of a magical Harrow deck to step in and ensure that fate is not stolen from the world!
<hr/>

objects.title: Gatewalkers
objects.text:
After they walked through that glowing gateway, nothing was ever the same. A band of characters become paranormal investigators in order to figure out the cause of a global amnesic episode. Their quest takes them to lands near, far, and outside of this reality altogether.
<hr/>

objects.title: Kingmaker
objects.text:
Face off against bands of bloodthirsty bandits, deadly and dangerous monsters, and mysterious menaces from other realities as you fight to claim the Stolen Lands as your own. Will you rule with justice and mercy, or will you become the very monsters you fought to oppose?
<hr/>

objects.title: Blood Lords
objects.text:
The undead nation of Geb gains most of its international trade from the export of food grown on zombie-worked farms, but lately one farm has been the site of a series of strange occurrences. The Blood Lords Adventure Path, is a six-part, monthly campaign in which the characters rise from skilled troubleshooters to join the Blood Lords who rule a land of the dead.
<hr/>

objects.title: Fists of the Ruby Phoenix
objects.text:
The time has come again for the Ruby Phoenix Tournament! The sorcerer Hao Jin has invited only the strongest martial artists, adventurers, and fortune seekers to her world-famous fighting competition.
<hr/>

objects.title: The Abomination Vaults
objects.text:
Brave heroes must venture into a dungeon full of beasts and traps to prevent a spiteful villain from rising again!
<hr/>

objects.title: Agents of Edgewatch
objects.text:
Amid the hustle and bustle of the world-famous centennial Radiant Festival, the guards of the so-called Edgewatch precinct must ensure the festival’s success and the safety of Absalom’s citizens.
<hr/>

objects.title: Extinction Curse
objects.text:
Come one, come all! Spectacle meets savagery as the heroes strive to stop the Extinction Curse!
<hr/>

objects.title: 3rd Party Module
objects.text:
What awaits you in the wide world of Golarion.
<hr/>

rows.titleText:
